Índice K (ºC)

The K-index was composed for forecasting air mass thunderstorms, or thunderstorms with no dynamic triggering mechanism. The index is computed by first taking the 850 hPa temperature minus the 500 hPa temperature. Then secondly dew point temperature at 850 hPa is added to this difference. Larger values of this dew point indicate low level moisture present and increase the chance of convection. In a final step the 700 hPa dew point depression is substracted for the moisture input at mid levels. A small dew point depression at 700 hPa indicates a possibility for deep convection. If there is no significant moisture at 700 hPa there is a greater chance that entrainment of dry air would occur, given a parcel were lifted from beneath the 700 hPa level. If entrainment of dry air occurs, the parcel will become less buoyant (Bluestein, 1993).

In general, the higher the ambient or inflow K index value, the greater the potential for heavy rain. However, beware of low (less than 30) values of K. Since the K index includes the dewpoint depression (i.e., difference between the temperature and dewpoint temperature) at 700 mb, dry air at this level will cause a low K value. However, given moisture below 700 mb, unstable air, and a lifting mechanism, strong or severe organized thunderstorms, and even heavy rain, can still occur. Scattered diurnal convection occurring in an environment containing high K (and PW) values can cause a quick burst of very heavy rain.

  • El Índice K no proporciona información sobre inestabilidad por debajo del nivel de 850 hPa (por ejemplo, donde haya calentamiento marítimo intenso) ni sobre la humedad por debajo de ese mismo nivel.
  • Los valores de humedad pueden no ser representativos de las condiciones generales, particularmente en niveles medios.
  • Capas con humedad cerca de los niveles de 850 hPa o 700 hPa no serán tenidas en cuenta.
  • El índice es más fiable en zonas planas de elevaciones bajas o moderadas. No proporciona buenos resultados en altas elevaciones.
  • La interpretación del índice varía con la estación del año y la localización.

$$ K=(T_{850}-T_{500})+T_{d_{850}}-(T_{700}-T_{d_{700}}) $$
K-index TS probablity
<20 Thunderstorms unlikely
20 to 25Isolated thunderstorms
26 to 30Widely scattered thunderstorms
31 to 35Numerous thunderstorms
Above 35Thunderstorms very likely
